problem: Nextra build fails with 'Unexpected character #' in .mdx files in /pages/ subfolders.
cause: Nextra 2.x expects all documentation content to be in the /content/ directory, not /pages/. The /pages/ directory is for Next.js routes only. The '#' character is interpreted as an invalid export in /pages/.
fix: Move all .mdx and .md documentation files from /pages/[subfolders] to /content/[subfolders] (preserving structure).
Remove any Nextra documentation .mdx/.md files from /pages/ (leave only Next.js route files like _app.js, _document.js, api/ etc).
Ensure each /content/[section]/ has a valid _meta.js file listing the articles for sidebar navigation.
Update or create /content/index.mdx as the docs homepage.
Verify next.config.mjs has contentDirBasePath: 'content' and output: 'export'.

problem: Sidebar only shows 'home' and not a full navigation tree.
cause: _meta.js files in /content/[section]/ are empty or missing, so Nextra cannot build the sidebar.
fix: Auto-generate _meta.js files in each /content/[section]/, listing all .mdx/.md files in order.
Ensure each _meta.js exports an object with keys as filenames (without extension) and values as objects with title and optional type/order.

problem: Some articles do not render or are missing.
cause: Content files are not present in /content/ or are not referenced in _meta.js, so Nextra cannot find or render them.
fix: After moving files, ensure all .mdx/.md files are present in /content/ and referenced in the correct _meta.js for their section.
Check for typos or missing index.mdx files in each section.

action: Copied all .mdx files from /pages/api-reference to /content/api-reference, overwriting placeholders.
result: api-reference docs are now in the correct location for Nextra. Ready for sidebar _meta.js generation.
